EditorData.stateContext: Player has pulled out a wand.

Text.Value: Snap the wand in two.
I don't even know if he's in there.

EditorData.NodeContext: You sound heartbroken as you look at the love of your life.

Text.Value: Light wanes only to wax again - and though life fades, memory shall not.
What in the hells was that?

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has said a cruel prayer you're horrified and shocked - quickly turning to anger.

Text.Value: You suffered and endured - may the Broken One shoulder your burdens, that you might walk free.
The thought of putting him in a wheelbarrow and making the journey all over again... *Sigh.*

EditorData.NodeContext: turns back to the grave, arms crossed - then gestures to the coffin. Trying not to cry.

Text.Value: What?

EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed - this player has pissed you off at least once already

Text.Value: Another reminder of mortal fragility. I am grateful for this gift.
He's not a creature! He's my husband.

EditorData.NodeContext: The player has called the zombie a 'thing'. The love and adoration for the man your husband once was obvious in your voice.

Text.Value: I'll do it. I'll take him.

EditorData.NodeContext: Firm - summoning your courage.

Text.Value: Then why are you even here? Damn it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Disgusted and angry

Text.Value: We've barely spent a day apart since.
*You feel something pull at you. The creature yearns - for a master.*
What have you done?! You BASTARD!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~The player snaps the wand in two
EditorData.NodeContext: Absolute horror, pain and fury

Text.Value: Pocket the wand anyway.
Point the wand towards the coffin.
He was... he is afraid of the dark.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gentle and soft voice as you think of Connor.

Text.Value: Not permanent? Bits of him are falling off.

EditorData.NodeContext: Horrified - upset

Text.Value: Bring him back. Bring Connor back - please.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sincere and pleading

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~The player hands the wand to Mayrina

Text.Value: He'd have liked that. Thanks.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has said a prayer that has made you feel much better. Sincere thanks as you hold back tears.

Text.Value: Please. Connor used to say only a fool turned down the divine.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sincere. Grateful. Trying not to cry.

Text.Value: I'm sorry this is how things turned out.
No. The dead should stay dead.
This man's death came too soon. See to it, Wounded Tyr, that he find some justice beyond the grave.
*You feel a surge of power from the wand - the air suddenly tastes acrid. It wants to be used.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~The player pulls out wand, which sparks in the player's hand

Text.Value: I could say a prayer, if you'd like.
You're a miserable bastard, you know that?

EditorData.NodeContext: Shaking head as you look at player with anger and pity.

Text.Value: I'll... I'll figure something out. C'mon, love. Let's... let's go.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Mayrina takes her husband and leaves
EditorData.NodeContext: Voice almost breaking on 'let's go home' as she takes the man that was once her husband back to the home they built together.

Text.Value: Whining won't get you there any faster.
Argh.

EditorData.NodeContext: Guttural noise - staring blankly

Text.Value: You join the same path as all those before - may Kelemvor guide your steps.
I can't. I don't have the wand anymore.
Maybe someone in Baldur's Gate can help us. Connor always said you can find anything in that city.

EditorData.NodeContext: Firm - summoning your courage.

Text.Value: No! Don't! CONNOR!

EditorData.NodeContext: Player is about to kill the zombie - your husband. You scream and are about to throw yoruself in their path.

Text.Value: Your husband's gone - this thing is just a monster.
Arggh...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~The player moves the wand around and the zombie follows the commands implied. [Jurassic Park style]
EditorData.NodeContext: start in kneeling position, stand up as you groan

Text.Value: Gods. Why wasn't it me? Connor...

EditorData.NodeContext: The player has said some harsh words that have made you cry even harder - the full reality of your grief hittin gyou.

Text.Value: Point the wand towards the grave.
I thought you were going to help! I thought - I thought...

EditorData.AnimationTags: Mayrina collapsing onto the floor crying
EditorData.NodeContext: Absolute breakdown. You're hysterical, crying. collapse on the floor, bawling your eyes out

Text.Value: Hold on - maybe it's not permanent.
No! I won't let you put him back there.
Call on your god to smite the undead.
He got right up and pushed me back. I was so surprised that I just laughed. He did too.
Gods, didn't hear you coming. I know I should head home, but I can't bring myself to leave.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Autine Ethel doing a spell to resurrect Connor, she is all over the top and dramatic
EditorData.NodeContext: look up from quietly crying, surprised

Text.Value: He's all yours - you'll need this wand.

EditorData.stateContext: The player has put the wand away.

Text.Value: I wanted him back - back the way he was. Not this.

EditorData.NodeContext: fighting back tears, gesturing at the zombie on "this"

Text.Value: So the hag fulfils her promise. It can never be simple, can it?
But he might be. And if he is, I'll find him and bring him back.

EditorData.NodeContext: Firm - summoning your courage.

Text.Value: I promised him I'd fix this. And I'm gonna. Maybe - maybe someone in Baldur's Gate can help us.

EditorData.NodeContext: This is softest and most loving we've seen Mayrina. She loves her husband and is gonna do everything she can to help him.

Text.Value: I miss him. Every moment of every day. Godsdammit.

EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed at yourself as you sturggle to hold back tears. Just about keeping it together

Text.Value: No! Don't put him in the ground!

EditorData.AnimationTags: Ethel canceling spell cast, Zombie recovering from pain
EditorData.NodeContext: You snap back to reality as you realise they're taking your husband - zombie or not, he's still your Connor. You interrupt Ethel's spell, reaching out in protest.

Text.Value: You died as you lived - pathetically and without purpose.
Connor always said you can find anything in that city. Remember?

EditorData.NodeContext: Voice soft and gentle as you think of your husband. Turn to him, this horrible zombie, at 'Remember?'/ Zombie merely stares back.

Text.Value: May you dance beneath the boughs - happy and free.
Don't worry - I have the wand. I'll make use of him.
Quietly whisper a blessing for protection. May Mayrina and her child suffer no harm.
What - what's happening? Why is he still dead?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player points the wand toward the grave. Door of coffin burst open. Zombie roughly stands, moaning and groaning as they stand - stepping out of it. Horrible sight, all rough movements and shuffling,
EditorData.NodeContext: Horror and fear

Text.Value: Leave.
We can always bury him again.

EditorData.stateContext: The player has given the wand to Mayrina

Text.Value: I found a wand - I think I can resurrect your husband.
But this isn't what she promised!

EditorData.NodeContext: Fighting back tears as you realise the hag double crossed you

Text.Value: You don't know that. He - he could still be in there. And I gotta try.

EditorData.NodeContext: This is softest and most loving we've seen Mayrina. She loves her husband and is gonna do everything she can to help him.

Text.Value: You could just leave him here.
No. This is my fault. And I'm - I'm gonna fix it.

EditorData.NodeContext: This is softest and most loving we've seen Mayrina. She loves her husband and is gonna do everything she can to help him.

Text.Value: Chaff for the Reaper's harvest. May his bleached bones march in your host, great Myrkul.
I'm sorry. I'm sorry I couldn't bring you back.

EditorData.NodeContext: Staring at coffin - crying

Text.Value: No! You monster! I - I won't let you!

EditorData.AnimationTags: Mayrina throwing herself at the player
EditorData.NodeContext: You take a defensive stance.This person has murdered your brothers and now taken your husband - you're desperate and hysterical and have nothing left to lose.

Text.Value: Not even a little bit. But I will be.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sad but determined - you're allowing yourself this time to grieve but you're determined to get through it. Arms crossed, not looking at player - staring at coffin.

Text.Value: No. He deserves a proper burial. He deserves some rest. And he won't get that here.

EditorData.NodeContext: Pain at the thought - he's been through enough. Arms crossed, not looking at player - staring at coffin.

Text.Value: I'll find a wizard or something. Maybe someone in Baldur's Gate can help us.
Are you all right?
This is your husband - do you want him or not?
Are you sure you want to do this?
A beloved husband and father - his vigil is ended, great Guardian.
Vermin dies as vermin lived. Good riddance.

EditorData.stateContext: The player has given the wand to Mayrina

Text.Value: Get away from us. Now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Ibid.

Text.Value: Leave.
And thank you. I guess.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to be sincere - despite how awful the situation is

Text.Value: You bastard! Give him back!
We were just kids when we met. Heh. I might have pushed him off a swing I wanted.

EditorData.NodeContext: Smile and love in your voice as you talk about your husband

Text.Value: Kill the undead abomination.
Connor? CONNOR!

EditorData.NodeContext: desperately trying to get through

Text.Value: Where there is peace, may you have it. Where there is comfort, may those you love know it.
He's already dead. Don't get in my way.
Leave her to mourn.
Here's the wand. Good luck to you and Connor.
Thank you.
What? You can?

EditorData.NodeContext: hopeful disbelief. Drop arms and stare at player.

Text.Value: I can't believe it didn't work. That all of this was for nothing.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying not to cry - feeling hopeless and exhausted

Text.Value: Wife without husband, child without father - Dark Lady, two more know the loss of your embrace.
Thanks, but we'll need more than luck. A bloody miracle more like it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~The player hands the wand to Mayrina
EditorData.NodeContext: Grim but trying to summon her determination

Text.Value: Huh. The creature's bound to this wand. How useful.
Gods, don't creep up on people.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Autine Ethel doing a spell to resurrect Connor, she is all over the top and dramatic
EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated. Looks up from quietly crying

Text.Value: You said you can resurrect my husband? Bring him back. Bring Connor back. Please.
What have you done to him?!

EditorData.NodeContext: panicking

Text.Value: Snap the wand in two.
C'mon, love. Let's go.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Mayrina takes her husband and leaves
EditorData.NodeContext: To your zombie husband. Gentle and loving tone as you gesture to go. Like to a child.

Text.Value: I'll be out of your hair soon. I just... can't bring myself to leave.

EditorData.NodeContext: Frustration turning to sadness

Text.Value: Stand with her in silence.
The weak fall to make way for the strong - and the Dark One smiles.

Synopsis: The player has discovered a wand that will allow them to raise Mayrina's husband from the dead. Mayrina is standing by the coffin that holds her dead husband. When player raises Connor from the dead, the coffin door bursts open and he crawls out of it a zombie - unable to speak in anything other than moans and groans. Player can take the zombie as a summon, kill the zombie, or give the zombie to Mayrina.
